meanings.definition: Having a tendency or preference towards something.
meanings.sent1: She is inclined to choose vanilla ice cream over chocolate.
meanings.sent2: He always seems inclined to help others in need.
meanings.sent3: The cat is inclined to nap in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The tree's branches are inclined towards the sky, reaching for the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Children are naturally inclined to explore and learn new things.

meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was placed inclined against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The roof was slightly inclined to allow rainwater to drain off easily.
meanings.sent3: The tower leaned inclined after the strong winds.
meanings.sent4: She stood inclined to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent5: The ski slope was steep and inclined, making it challenging for beginners.

meanings.definition: Willing or disposed to do something.
meanings.sent1: He is inclined to try new foods when traveling.
meanings.sent2: She is always inclined to lend a helping hand to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed inclined to chase after the squirrel in the park.
meanings.sent4: The river is inclined to overflow during heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The student was inclined to participate actively in class discussions.
